title.narrative: Economic Revitalization of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Economic Revitalization of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) and Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) Project for Pakistan is to support the Government of Pakistan in the economic recovery and revitalization of the crisis affected areas of KP province and FATA, by creating sustainable employment opportunities through rehabilitation of small and medium enterprises (SMEs), investment mobilization, and institutional capacity building. This restructuring will bring the following changes: (i) extension in the project closing date (PCD) from June 30, 2015 to October 31, 2015. Once the amendments to the administrative agreement for the extension of round one of the multi donor trust fund (MDTF) are signed, then the task team will process another eight month extension of the project; and (ii) a reallocation of cost within components 2 and 3 of the project. United States (U.S.) 0.3 million dollars is being reallocated from component 2 to component 3.

participating-org.narrative: GOVERNMENT OF KHYBER PAKHTUNKHWA (KP) AND FATA SECRETARIAT
GOVERNMENT OF KHYBER PAKHTUNKHWA (KP) AND FATA SECRETARIAT

title.narrative: Number of direct jobs created by the enterprises supported through the Project.
Number of direct jobs created for women through the matching grants.
Percentage of the matching grants beneficiaries operational and productive at the completion of the Project.
SME beneficiaries of the MGs, of which at least 5 percent are owned/managed by women entrepreneurs.
Investment attracted from the Diaspora and private enterprises.
Number of private enterprises using the Tourism Management Systems developed by the project.
Investment facilitation authorities established in FATA and KP.
SME Rehabilitation Support provided through the MGs.
Re-connect Pakistan (web tools for Diaspora) operational
Officials of the IEs and relevant departments of KP and FATA receive training in technical areas, including (i) trade and commerce,(ii) tourism, and (iii) PPPs.
SME owners satisfied with the processing of the MGs under the AF.
Diaspora Outreach program implemented: At least 7 to 10 outreach activities/events successfully organized
Number of SMEs/clusters that have used the Business Development Services (BDS).
SME beneficiaries of the up-gradation MGs.
Number of scalable investment projects and activities identified in the competitive sectors of KP and FATA.
Machinery pools/common facility supported by the Project.
Number of individuals (including women) in FATA that received training in the pine nut value chains.
